page.title: 01An Introduction to Creeting
page.content: This area consists mainly of one village; Creeting St. Mary, though small parts of Creeting St. Peter and Coddenham are included. Creeting St. Mary is an attractive village of 800 people. Most of the land is used for growing wheat and barley. The soil is mainly of heavy clay except for a small area of sandpit{S} and two or three marshy spots{S and N}. The river Gipping runs through the village from Stowmarket to Ipswich {W to S}. This attracts wild life and is popular for fishing. The houses in Creeting vary from Tudor cottages to modern chalet bungalows. They are mainly found along one road which stretches from one end of the village to the other Creeting St. Mary is within easy reach of Stowmarket and Ipswich.
